index.status: Get the status from the index process
index.all: Number of the last indexes to be kept
index.inaktive: Deletes all inactive products from the existing index
index.validate: You need select the shop for the index process
index.info: Please consider that depending on the number of articles, you need several minutes for the index process. The indexing is only finished when you can read  (The index process now finish).
index.mainInfo: Please note the plugin configuration. If you have selected the (only main products) is this option without function
index.memoryInfo: Here you can specify a memory limit in megabytes for the Index command

detail.infoAutocomplete: Please don't use the autocomplite filter  with the Shopware synonyms
detail.infoEdge: Please don't use the edges Tokenizers with the Shopware synonyms
detail.shoplanguage: Selected language (please only fill in if you want to have the field configured with differently langauge for the sales channels)
detail.prefix: A prefix is required to define different tokenizers per field
detail.boost: Here you can boost a field to prefer it
detail.shop: Channel (please only fill in if you want to have the field configured differently for the sales channels)
detail.filter1: Filter 1 (When choosing with caution, not all combinations will work)
detail.stemming: Stemming (if you use multiple languages in your channel you should not use this option)
detail.stop: Here you can define your own stop words comma separated
detail.strip: Add tags that you don't want to remove (Enter comma separated tags: b,strong,p,usw)
detail.synonym: Define synonyms for the filter synonyms
detail.maxexpansions: (Optional, integer) Maximum number of terms to which the query will expand. Defaults to 50
detail.slop: A phrase query matches terms up to a configurable slop (which defaults to 0) in any order. Transposed terms have a slop of 2.
detail.autosynonyms: If true, match phrase queries are automatically created for multi-term synonyms
detail.minimumshouldmatch: (Optional, string) Minimum number of clauses that must match for a document to be returned.
detail.prefixlength: Number of beginning characters left unchanged for fuzzy matching.
detail.lenient: If true, format-based errors, such as providing a text query value for a numeric field, are ignored. Defaults to false.
detail.punctuation: Komma and punctuation, minus in the token
detail.merge: Inserts the value of this field into the product name. This is needed to improve the prioritization for many fields
detail.phpfilter: Remove special characters from the index. Can be combined very well with the Whitespace Tokenizer
detail.onlymain: Search only in the main products.
detail.fuzzyDeprecated: Please do not use for ES 8
detail.excludesearch: With the setting you can remove this field from the search query

help.boost: Define here which field is preferred in the search results. Immediately available
help.tokenizer: The Tokenizer defines how the text is stored in the Elasticsearch database and has a major influence on the search results. You can find more information at any time in the Elasticsearch documentation https://www.elastic.co/guide/index.html. After the index process available
help.stemming: Select your language. After the index process available
help.stop: Here you can define your own stop words. After the index process available
help.stemming_stop: Enable the stop words for your selected language. After the index process available
help.edge: Maximum of the continuous number of letters in the search word (see Elasticsearch documentation https://www.elastic.co/guide/index.html). After the index process available
help.minedge: Minimum of the continuous number of letters in the search word (see Elasticsearch documentation https://www.elastic.co/guide/index.html). After the index process available
help.synonym: See Elasticsearch documentation See Elasticsearch documentatio https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-synonym-tokenfilter.html. After the index process available
help.maxexpansions: Immediately available and not available under the phrase query
help.slop: Immediately available. Only available under Phrase Query see Elasticsearch documentation
help.operator: Immediately available and not available under the phrase query
help.autosynonyms: Immediately available and not available under the phrase query
help.minimumshouldmatch: Immediately available and not available under the phrase query
help.prefixlength: Immediately available and not available under the phrase query
help.onlymain: Es muss unbedingt der Komplette Index neu aufgebaut werden das Sie sonst zur einer Fehlermeldung kommt.
